title: Changing letters after using Firefox for a while
content:
Hello! I’ve got a very strange problem with Firefox. After launching it, everything is fine, but after a while of use (some minutes, some hours - it’s completely different), the letters change and all the content of the visited website is completely unreadable (see attached screenshot). When closing Firefox and launching it again, the problem has gone, but not for long ... My system: Mac Pro Mid 2010, OS High Sierra, 12GB RAM, Graphic card AMD Radeon HD 7970 3072 MB.

All the others applications (like InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, Safari etc.) are running without any problem. Is there anyone having an idea how to solve the problem finally? Thank you & Best regards Dietrich

title: Tabs gone after closing Firefox
content:
Generally if someone links a Youtube video I'll watch it in a private window so Youtube doesn't trash my recommended videos with 100's of videos of the video I just watched so I opened a video in a private window...one video lead to another and another and before I knew it I had 6-7 tabs open in this private window.

I planned on restarting Firefox as it had been open for over a week and was using like 2-3gigs so while I had this private window open I decided to close my main Firefox window (with all the tabs) and continue watching a video in the private window and after 30-40 minutes I finally close the private window and reopen Firefox...all my tabs are gone from my main Firefox window, I probably had like 30 tabs open of various things.

There is nothing listed under recently closed tabs/windows so restore all tabs/windows does nothing.

This has to be a bug or something...I had no idea if you closed your main Firefox window and continued browsing around in a private window and eventually close it that every tab you had open in your main Firefox window would just magically disappear, is there anyway to restore the tabs or an old session? (my Firefox version is 84.0)

title: Saving the file associations to handlers.json no longer works
content:
I work on local web platform where I need to have quick access to several thousands of Word documents. I access these docs by clicking a link on the platform. To speed up things, I had all the file associations saved in this file:

Mozilla\Firefox\Profiles\<profile_name>\handlers.json

This way, each file opens quickly, without Firefox asking me about the application I'd like to use to open it.

These associations also show up in this menu: 'OPTIONS -> GENERAL -> FILE & APLICATIONS -> Choose how Firefox handles the files you download from the web or the applications you use while browsing.'

Ever since updating Firefox to version 84.0, this no longer works, as Firefox is once again showing up a small window, with this question:

"Allow this site to open the '<file_association_name>' link?"

I believe something changed with this latest version, as I have not changed anything to my configuration.

My goal is to save these associations so that I can skip this question when opening a file. Checking the "always allow" option won't help me that much since I have thousands of Word files.

So, it used to work by saving these associations to the 'handlers.json' file, but ever since I updated to the latest version, this no longer works.

Any idea about what could be the problem?

Thank you,

Alex
creator: dragosrobuc

title: Utilización de certificados personales
content: Actualmente tengo 3 certificados instalados en el navegador. Aunque tengo puesta la opción de preguntar siempre, cada vez que salgo de la sesión de alguna web y quiero entrar con otro certificado, me vuelve a acreditar con el que ya entré, en vez de volver a preguntar. Aunque cierre el navegador y lo vuelva a abrir, solo accede con el primero que marqué, haciendo que tenga que utilizar otro navegador para acceder con los otros. ¿Cómo puedo solucionar el problema? Gracias.

title: No puedo cambiar de Certificado de Usuario. Siempre sale el mismo
content:
Good morning and than you very much for your help.

I have a problem with the choice of the Digital Certificate that has started to happen as a result of the last update.

The first time a User Certificate is selected, Firefox remembers it forever (even if you close the browser or reset the computer) and no longer allows you to select another User Certificate.

Best regards.

Javier.

title: Switching Between Seperate Firefox Accounts
content: My brother and I have separate Firefox accounts. He stays with me a lot for weeks or even months at a time. He's not an avid smart phone user. He prefers a desktop PC just as I do. The big problem is we can't switch accounts. All his passwords and web sites are linked to his account, the same as mine is to mine. If I log out of my Firefox and he attempts to log into his, we get a warning that all synced items will be merged. We end up not switching. This is very frustrating for him since he doesn't remember his sign-in's. He relies on his Firefox account for that. Is there any way around this? We can do it with Google and his AOL accounts. Anybody have any ideas?

title: Is it possible to share a FF profile on two computers?
content:
I have been using Firefox for ages now, and collected a rather large number of bookmarks (>15,000) As far as I know such a number poses some issues, for instance I tried several times to use Sync but was never able to use it.

Since I am using two different machines, I tend to save my bookmarks only on the main one. When I am working on the laptop I never save bookmarks but I message them to myself (never been able to save them on my main machine, sigh) and every once in a while I "restore" bookmarks from the backup set of the main machine on the laptop. It always takes a while and oftentimes it feels like the process hangs, but so far I managed.

Today I started wondering again if there's a less frustrating and more efficient way to handle this. The question I started asking myself was: could I use the same FF profile from the laptop & the main machine? Say by saving it in the cloud?

Thanks for any hint or suggestion!
creator: giampaolo44

title: Cannot access/recover 7,500 tabs from old profile
content:
Hi,

This is my first time posting here. I had written detailed information, then scrolled down to the troubleshooting information section and made the mistake of clicking: try these manual steps.

That link should have opened in a new tab! I lost everything I wrote here, pressing back didn't preserve the text I had entered here.

I have 7,500 tabs in an old profile on my laptop. After many crashes and using Refresh, I can't fix it as I did before.

Please fix this Ask Your Question page so it doesn't lose what I've written here so easily. Show a warning, and open links in new tabs.

And Firefox should have an option to automatically bookmark open tabs so that if anyone experiences this crash/corruption I've had, all their open tabs are safely backed up in bookmarks and Firefox sync.

Also the Submit Feedback button in Firefox's help menu is still going to a page showing: Please check back soon. Feels like it's been a month since I was last able to send feedback. Please fix this!

Thanks!
creator: Aku-Solus
